channel.title: CVE Feed for frappe -- frappe
channel.description: The latest CVEs for frappe -- frappe

item.title: CVE-2023-46127|2024-09-11T15:23:48.149Z -- frappe -- frappe
item.description: Frappe is a full-stack web application framework that uses Python and MariaDB on the server side and an integrated client side library. A malicious Frappe user with desk access could create documents containing HTML payloads allowing HTML Injection. This vulnerability has been patched in version 14.49.0.

item.title: CVE-2024-34074|2024-08-02T02:43:00.126Z -- frappe -- frappe
item.description: Frappe is a full-stack web application framework. Prior to 15.26.0 and 14.74.0, the login page accepts redirect argument and it allowed redirect to untrusted external URls. This behaviour can be used by malicious actors for phishing. This vulnerability is fixed in 15.26.0 and 14.74.0.

item.title: CVE-2024-27105|2024-03-20T18:11:58.069Z -- frappe -- frappe
item.description: Frappe is a full-stack web application framework. Prior to versions 14.66.3 and 15.16.0, file permission can be bypassed using certain endpoints, granting less privileged users permission to delete or clone a file. Versions 14.66.3 and 15.16.0 contain a patch for this issue. No known workarounds are available.

item.title: CVE-2024-24813|2024-03-20T18:11:34.165Z -- frappe -- frappe
item.description: Frappe is a full-stack web application framework. Prior to versions 14.64.0 and 15.0.0, SQL injection from a particular whitelisted method can result in access to data which the user doesn't have permission to access. Versions 14.64.0 and 15.0.0 contain a patch for this issue. No known workarounds are available.

item.title: CVE-2024-34074|2024-06-04T17:41:36.130Z -- frappe -- frappe
item.description: Frappe is a full-stack web application framework. Prior to 15.26.0 and 14.74.0, the login page accepts redirect argument and it allowed redirect to untrusted external URls. This behaviour can be used by malicious actors for phishing. This vulnerability is fixed in 15.26.0 and 14.74.0.

Prior to versions 14.66.3 and 15.16.0, file permission can be bypassed using certain endpoints, granting less privileged users permission to delete or clone a file. Versions 14.66.3 and 15.16.0 contain a patch for this issue. No known workarounds are available.

Versions 14.66.3 and 15.16.0 contain a patch for this issue. No known workarounds are available.

item.title: CVE-2024-24813|2024-08-05T19:24:50.323Z -- frappe -- frappe
item.description: Frappe is a full-stack web application framework. Prior to versions 14.64.0 and 15.0.0, SQL injection from a particular whitelisted method can result in access to data which the user doesn't have permission to access. Versions 14.64.0 and 15.0.0 contain a patch for this issue. No known workarounds are available.
